critique: This executive order amends a previous order (10865) concerning security requirements for government employees and contractors. It primarily clarifies definitions and procedures related to cross-examination of witnesses in security clearance cases. There's no indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, or social inclusion. The order seems to focus on procedural aspects within the executive branch and doesn't dramatically shift power dynamics related to federalism or economic regulation. It touches on national security by addressing security clearances, but also emphasizes due process through cross-examination, suggesting a balanced approach. It expands executive power slightly by including more department heads and deputies.
